cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 145 mi (235 km) SE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Turning northwest tonight, then north-northwest on Sunday, carrying the core across the Florida Keys at daybreak Sunday and up the southwest coast of Florida thereafter

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Fernandina Beach FL to Edisto Beach SC; west of the Aucilla River to Indian Pass FL (Hurricane Watch); additional Storm-Surge Watch north of Volusia/Brevard line to Isle of Palms SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Fernandina Beach southward around the entire Florida peninsula to the Aucilla River, including Port Everglades, the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and Florida Bay (Hurricane Warning); Storm-Surge Warning Volusia/Brevard line southward around the peninsula to the Suwannee River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coast from Palm Beach through Miami–Dade and Broward (Port Everglades) to the Keys is expected to experience tropical-storm to hurricane conditions
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds expected to begin Saturday evening with a 67-88% chance and a 29% chance of sustained 50-kt winds; brief hurricane-force gusts possible Sunday morning as the eye passes to the southwest
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 2–4 ft above ground for the Broward/Miami-Dade coastline (Port Everglades lies just north of the 4–6 ft zone, but 3-4 ft is still possible)
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain with isolated 20 inches possible across the south-central Florida peninsula, bringing risk of flash flooding at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Saturday night–Sunday; dangerous surf and rip currents
